executable.title: Grayscale Model Maker
executable.description: Create 3D surface models from grayscale data. This module uses Marching Cubes to create an isosurface at a given threshold. The resulting surface consists of triangles that separate a volume into regions below and above the threshold. The resulting surface can be smoothed and decimated. This model works on continuous data while the module Model Maker works on labeled (or discrete) data.

image.name: InputVolume
image.label: Input Volume
image.description: Volume containing the input grayscale data.

float.name: Threshold
float.description: Grayscale threshold of isosurface. The resulting surface of triangles separates the volume into voxels that lie above (inside) and below (outside) the threshold.
float.label: Threshold

string.name: Name
string.label: Model Name
string.description: Name to use for this model.

integer.name: Smooth
integer.label: Smooth
integer.description: Number of smoothing iterations. If 0, no smoothing will be done.

float.name: Decimate
float.label: Decimate
float.description: Target reduction during decimation, as a decimal percentage reduction in the number of polygons. If 0, no decimation will be done.

boolean.name: SplitNormals
boolean.label: Split Normals?
boolean.description: Splitting normals is useful for visualizing sharp features. However it creates holes in surfaces which affect measurements

boolean.name: PointNormals
boolean.label: Compute Point Normals?
boolean.description: Calculate the point normals? Calculated point normals make the surface appear smooth. Without point normals, the surface will appear faceted.

boolean.name: Debug
boolean.label: Debug
boolean.description: Turn this flag on to log more details during execution.
